properties.Name: ComponentExtraordinaryRepair
properties.Description:
Extraordinary repairs is work performed upon a network component that extends the life of the fixed asset for more than one year.  

Extraordinary repairs are handled differently from an accounting perspective in that they are capitalized and not expensed.   

Extraordinary repairs are charged to the accumulated depreciation account and therefore increase the book value of the network component.

Columns.Name: ComponentExtraordinaryRepairId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Component Extraordinary Repair.

Columns.Name: ComponentId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Component.

Columns.Name: ExtraordinaryRepairTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of an Extraordinary Repairs Type.

Columns.Name: RepairPlannedTimestamp
Columns.Description: The timestamp that the Repair was planned to start.

Columns.Name: RepairStartedTimestamp
Columns.Description: The timestamp that Repair actually was started.

Columns.Name: RepairCompletedTimestamp
Columns.Description: The timestamp that the Repair was completed.

Columns.Name: RepairEstimatedCost
Columns.Description: The estimated cost of the Repair.

Columns.Name: RepairActualCost
Columns.Description: The actual cost of the Repair.

Columns.Name: RepairNote
Columns.Description: Notes, comments or additional information regarding Extraordinary Repairs.

Columns.Name: VendorId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Vendor.

Columns.Name: ContractId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Contract.

Columns.Name: WorkOrderId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Work Order.
